page.title: 04CATON'S IMPRESSIONIST
page.content: Moni Jones is an impressionist painter who uses oil paints.She lives in Farrar House on Hornby Road.She started painting at secondary school when 16. After school she won a scholarship to go to art college,where she studied graphic design and became a designer for 6 years.She then started painting seriously.At first,her paintings cost around 15-30 pounds,now they can cost anything from 80 to 500 pounds.A painting can take from 2 hours to 2 weeks depending on how complicated it is.Her own favourite paintings are a series she did on Littledale in Bluebell Time.She spends 4 to 5 hours every day on general painting work.Her favourite subjects to paint are flowers and trees.Her other pastimes are swimming,walking,looking after the children and running a Bed and Breakfast business at Farrar House.
